intro: Fernandezia barnettiae, commonly known as the Juan Fernández cactus, is a rare and unique plant native to the Juan Fernández Islands in Chile. It belongs to the cacti family, Cactaceae, and is characterized by its spiny, columnar stems that store water. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom during the warmer months, typically from September to December. Fernandezia barnettiae is adapted to the harsh, coastal environment of its native habitat, with features that help it survive in arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and threats from habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species.
